newsitem.title: NORWAY: Statoil group to apply for Barents licence.
newsitem.headline: Statoil group to apply for Barents licence.

text.p: Den norske stats oljeselskap (Statoil), Amoco Corp, Elf Aquitaine, Norsk Hydro, Mobil Corp and Saga Petroleum plan to submit a group application for exploration acreage in the southern Barents Sea, Statoil's Status Weekly newsletter said on Thursday.

The Norwegian government announced last week 86 full and partial blocks in the southern Barents region would be put forward for licensing, with February 5 the deadline for applications. Awards are expected in March or April, 1997.
Yngve Vassmyr, Statoil's project manager for the group, said the group was satisfied with the terms of the offer.
The geological risk in the acreage compared with deepwater targets in the Norwegian Sea and the many of the blocks had interesting potential, Vassmyr said.
Few, if any, wells have been drilled in the area.
The Energy Ministry has specified separate work models for the two types of acreage on offer.

Model I involves the normal specified work programme over 10 years, while Model II - "seismic areas" - covers blocks where the licensees will first collect seismic data for three to five years before discussions with the ministry on a production licence.
